description: Maps SSO security groups to dev sub-account IDs. Controls which Azure AD groups have permission to promote components from specific dev accounts to production. Manually managed by administrators.

fields.name: ssoGroupId
fields.description: Azure AD group object ID or canonical group name

fields.name: ssoGroupName
fields.description: Human-readable Azure AD group display name

fields.name: devAccountId
fields.description: Boomi dev sub-account ID that this group can promote from

fields.name: devAccountName
fields.description: Human-readable dev account name for display purposes

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: Enable/disable access without deleting record (values: 'true' or 'false')

matchRules.description: Compound match on SSO group ID and dev account ID (one group can access multiple accounts)

sources.name: ADMIN_CONFIG
sources.description: Manually seeded and maintained by system administrators via DataHub API

notes: This model provides the authorization layer for the promotion engine. During promotion, the engine validates that the authenticated SSO user belongs to a group with isActive='true' for the source dev account. Multiple groups can map to the same account, and one group can access multiple accounts.
